intro: Maripa cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' maripa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
